content:
You're welcome! It's always a good idea to check with the studio beforehand to know what to expect. And don't hesitate to ask the teacher or assistant for help during the class if you need any guidance with props or modifications.

Remember to also listen to your body and honor its limitations. Ashtanga can be a challenging practice, especially for beginners, so don't push yourself too hard. Take breaks when needed, and focus on breathing and alignment.

Most importantly, have fun and enjoy the experience! Ashtanga is a journey, and it's okay to take it one step at a time.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Good luck with your first class, and I hope you have a great time exploring Ashtanga!
